result.execSummary:
The defendant Chanda Fezer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges and Day Reporting Center.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered and subject to tax intercept.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor, or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No drugs or alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
Do not frequent places where alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs (unless with a prescriptio) are sold, distributed or used.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
________________
Court ordered defendasnt have a Physician Disclosure Form signed for any health, dental or medical prescriptions.
Court did not suspend the defendant's driving privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chanda Fezer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The Defendant's request for release privileges is GRANTED.  Defendant may be released for the following:  CHILD CARE.  Signed, scanned and filed, sdg.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for child care privileges.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hartley.  Defendant Chanda Fezer in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 23 days time served.  Huber privileges and Day Report Center. Court objects to electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol, illegal drug, or prescription drugs (unless with a prescription) are sold, distributed or used.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered subject to tax intercept.

Court ordered defendant have a Physician Disclosure Form signed for any health, dental, or medical prescriptions. 

Court DID NOT suspend the defendants driving privileges. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor, or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  


  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Defendant Chanda Fezer in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State file not in court. Court vacates warrant. Court issued a warrant due to non-compliance. State motions for revocation of the agreement. Defense requests another extension.   The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court issued a warrant on 2/10/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 4/14/2015, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney David Knute Ziemer in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. NO FILE IN COURT.  Matter called on the record for non-compliance.  Defendant has tested positive and has not attended appointments.  Court vacates the future court dates.   Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has tested negative and is employed.  Defendant needs to complete community service.  Review hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case trasferred from Br. 03 forthwith for change of plea.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.  

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for DPA hearing.  State needs to make sure the Day Reporting Center is the monitoring agency.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 9/17/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  State has offered the defendant a DPA.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 8/19/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David K Ziemer.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State may offer a DPA in this case.  Defendant to have TAD evaluation.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/15/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney David K Ziemer.  Nathaniel Adamson for Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chanda Fezer in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Katryna L Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 04.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/21/14 @ 1:30pm
